Publications¶

Please cite the following publication if you use the Beacon Calculus for your research:

Boemo, M.A., Cardelli, L., Nieduszynski, C.A. (2020) The Beacon Calculus: A formal method for the flexible and concise modelling of biological systems. PLoS Computational Biology (In Press). [Journal DOI] [bioRxiv]

Formal Definitions¶

Note that this documentation presents the Beacon Calculus informally by way of examples in order to make the method accessible to non-specialists. Users looking for a more formal specification of the language’s grammar and structural operational semantics are referred to the supplementary information of the above publication.

Bugs, Questions, and Comments¶

Should any bugs arise or if you have any questions about usage, please raise a GitHub issue. If you have comments or suggestions to improve the Beacon Calculus, the bcs software, or the documentation, please Email Michael Boemo at mb915@cam.ac.uk. Lastly, we are always keen to hear from biologists with an application in mind that would make for an interesting collaboration.
